intro: Dielsiocharis bactriana, commonly known as the Bactrian dielsiocharis, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a mild, aromatic scent. Due to its adaptability to harsh environments, it is sometimes used in traditional medicine and as a source of essential oils.
